text: president Donald Trump says transgender
people cannot serve in any capacity in
the military in a series of tweets mr.
Trump said he had reached the decision
after consulting senior military figures
and experts Barack Obama's
administration decided last year to
allow transgender people to serve openly
in the military it's been estimated that
there are more than two and a half
thousand transgender active duty service
personnel out of 1.2 million well a
short while ago our correspondent
Barbara pet Asha in Washington spoke
about the implications of the tweet you
know it's very difficult to analyze how
big a deal this is because it's come out
of the blue it's a couple of tweets this
morning making very categorical
statement saying that transgender
recruits or officers or soldiers are not
allowed to serve in any capacity because
the army should not be burdened with the
medical cost or the disruption and so on
so we've had the Pentagon refer all
questions to the White House it seems
that the Pentagon was not prepared to to
say this or to respond to it it looks as
if it was taken by surprise what we do
know is that the policy to accept
transgender recruits is under review now
that was made that decision was made a
year ago by the former administration
that transgender recruits would be
allowed to open to serve to apply to
serve openly from July 1st this year
when the new defense secretary came in
demand under the new administration he
said in principle he had no problem with
that but if he was faced with questions
or problems he would consider them then
just before July 1st he said he had been
faced with some questions so they would
extend a review for six months until
January 1st and the key point of it
would be will this affect the readiness
and the less ality of the the military
services but he said in no way does this
mean the outcome is presupposed and it
does not affect current policy policy
and procedures which is openly people
who are already in the Army and the
military who are transgender are serving
openly so this is completely this is
quite different from that approach which
is what we know publicly stated by the
Secretary of Defense a couple of weeks
ago it's very difficult therefore to say
where it comes from and how significant
it is yeah gosh how many times we've
spurred
president tweets without really knowing
where we're going with this but if we're
talking about seven thousand up to seven
thousand transgender service members
currently serving if President Trump has
his way but what happens then they get
fired do they well I guess I don't know
I mean presumably the Pentagon would
have something to say there are policies
and procedures in place I don't know if
mr. Trump can overturn them with the
tweet he's suggesting that he has been
in consultation with the Pentagon which
would mean perhaps there had been some
groundwork laid but that's not what
we've been told and that's not what the
procedures are in place so it's very
difficult to know that the policies that
are under review is the recruitment of
transgender candidates so mr. Trump for
example raised some issue what medical
costs yes that is an issue whether the
Army has to provide transition services
for people transitioning from one gender
to another as part of healthcare costs
now that would presumably affect people
already serving because what the
announcement said last year was those
who apply as new recruits they have to
have them sort of stable or comfortable
in their chosen gender for 18 months so
there all kinds of complicated questions
around this issue which the four
branches of the military had already
been looking into and which they had
been discussing with the Secretary of
Defense to what degree they've also been
discussing that directly with mr. Trump
and whether that changes policy
completely because of one tweet I guess
we'll have to wait and see barbar
plateau Jie
